messages.body: $EPR We need to assume the world is over and no one will ever go to movies again....

“AMC Theaters Considers Bankruptcy After Moviegoers Stay Home”

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-13/amc-theaters-said-to-mull-bankruptcy-after-moviegoers-stay-home

Every day I pick 2-5 stocks - the most undervalued stocks in AMEX, NYSE & NASDAQ to trade for the next trading day (in a live youtube stream at 3:50pm NY Time – Link Below). These stocks are generally undervalued following a decline in demand driven by declining investor confidence or their Fundamentals improve rapidly while the market price remains almost unchanged. I am targeting a trading goal of 50% return by Dec 31 2020. So far I am up 86%. Click below link for details. Below are my picks made today for tomorrow. Keep these stocks on your watchlist for the next 1-5 days. Some of them may see huge gains in the next 1-5 days:
$AMC $EPR $CHMA $VEDL $MUB

links.title: Market Composite
links.description: As the retail industry continues to evolve, both retail landlords and tenants are reconsidering what consumers want from a brick-and-mortar shopping experience. With a never-ending parade of 'disruptors' entering the retail landscape, one thing is becoming clear: landlords must view their retail tenants as partners who can help them make sense of the variable consumer and market trends that are transforming the industry.

links.title: EPR Properties down 9% after RBC bull throws in the towel
links.description: RBC analyst Michael Caroll downgrades EPR Properties to Market Perform from Outperform. He trims his price target to $32 from $41, which is still well above the current share price of $22.55.At issue are continued studio delays of major film releases..He also takes note of Tenet's underwhelming domestic box office, and Disney's strategic reorganization to accelerate its pivot toward direct-to-consumer.More opinion- 'ERP Properties: Live And Let Die' by contributor Brad Thomas.Quick look at the rental revenue and total revenue over the past years here.

messages.body: $EPR I'm surprised, this is actually looking like a good entry again. Going to start adding into close

$EPR EPR Properties slides 9%, downgraded from outperform to sector perform 

https://newsfilter.io/a/7752789a19ffb3e84e0199dadd80243a

links.title: EPR Properties slides 9%, downgraded from outperform to sector perform
links.description: EPR Properties downgraded from outperform to sector perform by RBC analyst Michael Caroll.He revised the price target to $32 from $41, citing more theatre operator risk as studios continue to delay big title releases.Analyst added, ''Given Tenet's underwhelming domestic box office, the fact that studios have again pushed release dates back and Disney's strategic reorganization to accelerate its pivot toward direct-to-consumer, he sees EPR Properties as "a high risk, high reward option."More opinion- 'ERP Properties: Live And Let Die' by contributor Brad Thomas.Quick look at the rental revenue and total revenue over the past years here.

links.title: Breakdown Stocks Today | NYSE, NASDAQ and AMEX.
links.description: This scan helps traders identify today's breakdown stocks as they happen. Breakdown stocks are defined as those having moved below support levels. Breakdown stocks often exhibit sharp and sudden downward moves. At Stockbeep we use the 5-day range to indicate current resistance and support levels.

links.title: Unusual Volume Losers Today - Down On High Relative Volume (RVol) | NYSE, NASDAQ and AMEX
links.description: Unusual volume losers are stocks that are moving lower on unusually high volume. Increased volume flows are correlated with volatility. A heightened volume indicates something is going on today and that the stock is "in play". A stock moving down on unusually high volume typically implies distribution of the stock.
